original_title: 1,100 employees of State Engineering Corporation to retire voluntarily
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Chairman of the State Engineering Corporation Rathnasiri Kalupahana says that 1,100 employees of the corporation volunteered to retire.
He says that however, 2.6 billion is required to compensate them.
He adds that problems have arisen with regard to acquiring the funds for compensating employees who retire voluntarily.
A tense situation arose in the State Engineering Corporation yesterday, due to the payment of only half of the salary for the month of June.
Its chairman Ratnasiri Kalupahana stated that due to the financial crisis, it was not possible to provide the full salary to the employees.
However, he said that the full salary will be paid next Monday (10).
